*Sun Zhenren’s Emergency Essential Prescriptions, Scroll Eighteen*
*Collated and Corrected by Lin Yi, Gentleman for Court Service, Acting Vice Minister of the Court of Imperial Sacrifices, and Academician of the Secret Pavilion, during the Song Dynasty*

**Formulas for Disorders of the Seven Orifices**
**Fourth Formula: Tongue Disorders**

**Cimicifuga Decoction**
The tongue governs the heart viscus; when heat arises, it manifests upon the tongue, causing sores, fissures, and cracking, with redness spreading to the lips. This formula drains heat:
*Three liang* each of *Sichuan cimicifuga* and *belamcanda rhizome*; one *sheng* of sliced *cypress leaf*; two *liang* of *dyer’s woad leaf*; five *ge* each of sliced *bitter bamboo leaf* and *rehmannia juice*; three *ge* of *fresh figwort juice*; eight *ge* of *red honey*; five *liang* each of *fresh reed rhizome* and *white bark of multiflora rose root*.
Grind the ten ingredients coarsely, then decoct in four *sheng* of water until one *sheng* remains. Strain, add the *figwort juice*, and bring to two boils; next add the *rehmannia juice*, bringing to two boils; then add the honey, and simmer until one *sheng* and seven *ge* remain. Soak silk floss in the liquid, squeeze out the juice, place upon the tongue, and swallow gradually.

**Formula for Tongue Sores Preventing Eating, with Stiffness at the Root and Pain on Both Sides of the Neck (Caused by Heart Vacuity Heat):**
Two *liang* each of *bupleurum*, *cimicifuga*, *peony*, *gardenia seed*, and *tetrapanax pith*; one and a half *liang* each of *scutellaria* and *dyer’s woad leaf*; one *liang* of *apricot kernel*; four *liang* each of *fresh ginger* and *gypsum*.
Grind the ten ingredients coarsely, then decoct in one *dou* and nine *sheng* of water until three and a half *sheng* remain. Divide into four doses, taking three during the day and one at night. The dregs may be decocted again for further use.

**Formula for Sudden Swelling of the Tongue, Filling the Mouth and Protruding Like a Blown-Up Pig’s Bladder, Obstructing Breath (If Untreated, Fatal in Moments):**
Urgent: Scrape both sides of the tongue with a finger to release the fluid, and recovery will follow. Alternatively, incise both sides with a lance, then apply wound ointment.
**Another Formula:**
Pierce the two large veins beneath the tongue to release blood, but avoid the central vein beneath the tongue—uncontrolled bleeding is fatal. If the above treatment fails or excessive blood loss occurs, heat an iron comb until red-hot and cauterize the wound several times to stanch the bleeding.
**Another Formula:**
Wash twelve *pinellia* tubers thoroughly, then decoct in one *sheng* of vinegar until eight *ge* remain. Hold the liquid in the mouth and rinse gradually, spitting it out. Adding one *liang* of *fresh ginger* enhances efficacy.

**Formula for Tongue Swelling Like a Pig’s Bladder:**
Grind soot from beneath a cauldron into powder, mix thickly with vinegar, and apply to the upper and lower surfaces of the tongue. Replace when dry; the swelling will subside shortly. If blood and fluid have already been drained, application is even more effective.
In all such cases, people often fail to recognize the condition, and misdiagnosis worsens the affliction, hastening death. Examine the underside of the tongue: there may appear creatures resembling mole crickets or silkworm pupae. Upon close inspection, they have heads and tails, with slightly white heads. Heat an iron nail and cauterize the head of the creature until cooked, and it will dissolve.

**Formula for Stiff, Swollen Tongue Filling the Mouth:**
Hold a small amount of sugar and vinegar in the mouth until warmth spreads, then cease.

**Formula for Tongue Swelling Filling the Mouth, Preventing Speech:**
One *sheng* of *water shield*; thirty-three *earthworms*.
Decoct the two ingredients in three *sheng* of water until three boils occur. Hold the liquid in the mouth, swallowing gradually, three times daily.

**Formula for Stiff Tongue Preventing Speech:**
*Alum* and *cassia heartwood*, in equal parts, ground to powder. Place beneath the tongue for immediate relief.

If the tongue turns black with several holes as large as chopsticks, from which blood gushes like a spring, this indicates a heart-organ disorder. The formula for its treatment:

Five *liang* each of *rong* salt, scutellaria (alternatively, mallow seeds), phellodendron, and rhubarb;
Two *liang* each of ginseng, cassia heartwood, and licorice.
Grind the seven ingredients into powder and form honeyed pills the size of parasol seeds. Take ten pills with water, three times daily.
Alternatively, cauterize with a heated iron comb.

**Formula for Blood Gushing from the Tongue Like a Spring:**
Cauterize the holes thoroughly with a heated iron comb; this is highly effective.

**Fifth Section on Lip Disorders: Methods for Jia Decoction and Moxibustion**

**Method for Scorched Lips Due to Spleen Heat #1**
**Spleen-Moistening Paste, a formula for spleen heat causing lips to scorch, dry, and lack moisture:**

One *sheng* each of fresh asparagus (cut) and fresh rehmannia juice;
Four *liang* each of fresh ophiopogon and Solomon’s seal;
Three *sheng* of lard;
Two *liang* each of asarum, licorice, chuanxiong, and atractylodes;
Three *liang* each of astragalus and cimicifuga.
Coarsely grind the eleven ingredients, soak them in vinegar overnight, then wrap in silk. When decocting, add the fresh rehmannia juice and lard, and simmer until the paste emits a crackling sound and all watery vapor dissipates. Strain and take small amounts to hold in the mouth.

**Jia Decoction Lip Balm, a formula for cracked, malodorous lips:**

First, pound hemp into a paste and coat the interiors of two fine porcelain jars (each with a capacity of one *dou* or more) to a thickness of half a *cun*, then sun-dry until firm.

Five *liang* of spikenard;
One *liang* each of *ai-na* fragrance, clover fragrance, and cogon grass;
Three *liang* of patchouli;
Four *liang* of *ling-ling* fragrance.
First, mix one *sheng* of wine with five *sheng* of water to make a decoction, wash the fragrances clean, then chop. Soak again in one *sheng* each of wine and water overnight. The next morning, take one *dou* and five *sheng* of sesame oil, add the six ingredients, and decoct over a low flame, stirring three times up and three times down. Strain and pour into one of the jars, leaving a small space unfilled.

Then take:
Three *jin* of high-grade agarwood;
Three *liang* each of sparrow-head fragrance and storax;
Five *liang* each of benzoin and sandalwood;
One *liang* each of clove, musk, and *jia* fragrance.
First, mix wine and water to make a decoction, wash the fragrances clean, then pound each separately (not too finely). Mix the fragrances with two *sheng* of honey and one *sheng* of wine, then pack tightly into the second jar. Seal the jar’s mouth with silk, secure it with crossed bamboo strips to prevent fragrance from escaping.

Bury the oil jar in the ground so its mouth is level with the surface. Place the fragrance jar upside-down over the oil jar, aligning their mouths. Seal the junction with hemp paste to a thickness of half a *cun*, ensuring it is firm and airtight. Pile chaff five *cun* thick over the jars and ignite. When the fire nearly extinguishes, add more chaff. Burn continuously for three days and nights without letting the fire die, using a total of twelve *shi* of chaff. Afterward, let it cool for three days before uncovering.

Separately, refine eight *jin* of wax, boiling it several times. Add twelve *liang* of gromwell, decocting until a gromwell stem, when scraped against a fingernail, reveals white beneath. Strain through silk, then blend with the previous decoction. Add six *liang* of cinnabar powder and stir well. While still warm but before it solidifies, pour into bamboo tubes. Wrap the tubes in paper and bind with hemp. Once cooled and set, unwrap and use as desired. This yields approximately fifty sticks.

**Jia Decoction Lip Balm, a formula for pale, bloodless lips and halitosis:**

**Method for Burning Fragrant Unction:**
Agarwood, *jia* fragrance, clove, musk, sandalwood, storax, frankincense, *ling-ling* fragrance, benzoin, patchouli, spikenard, and *ze-lan*.

The above twelve ingredients, each six *liang*, with five *sheng* of sesame oil. First, decoct the oil until hot, then add benzoin, patchouli, spikenard, and *ze-lan*. After a short time, remove from heat and strain through silk into a porcelain jar. Grind the remaining eight fragrances into powder, mix with honey—without making it too moist—and fill a small porcelain jar to the brim. Cover the mouth with silk, secure it with crossed bamboo strips, then invert the small jar over the larger oil jar so their mouths align. Seal tightly with clay. Dig a hole to bury the oil jar, level with the ground, then pile dry cow dung around it and ignite. Alternatively, use chaff for the fire. Burn continuously for seven days and nights; haste is unnecessary. Twelve days yields even better results. Once cooled, remove the contents—now complete.

The jars must be evenly coated with well-kneaded clay, one *cun* thick, and sun-dried before use.

**Method for Refining Wax and Blending with Jia Decoction:**
Two *liang* each of wax and gromwell. First, melt the wax, then add gromwell and decoct briefly. Test by scraping a gromwell stem against a fingernail—if the inner flesh appears white, remove it. Add the wax, ensuring it does not solidify, then pour in one *he* of Jia Decoction. Stir evenly, pour into tubes, and avoid disturbing until cool and set. This yields fine lip balm.

Apply to lips and face three times daily.

**Formula for Tight Lips:**
Roll white cloth into a thick wick the size of a finger, place on a cleaver blade, and light it over a stove until the blade sweats. Wipe the moisture onto the lips, two or three times daily. Used cloth works as well, and this also treats sunken lips.

**Alternative Formulas:**
- Apply the ash of a naturally deceased mole cricket.
- Warm pine resin and apply to heal.
- Burn clean snake skin to ash and apply.
- Heat wax and press onto the lips to heal.
- Take mole cricket ash with water.
- Take ash of green cloth with wine, or mix with fat and apply.
- Moxibustion at *Hukou* (tiger’s mouth): left for men, right for women.
- Moxibustion at *Chengjiang* (CV 24), three cones.

**Formula for Sunken Lips:**
Burn dried mole crickets to ash, mix with lard, and apply before sleep.

**Alternative Formula:**
Burn turtle shell and head until smoke dissipates, grind to powder, and apply three times daily.

**Formula for Lip Sores:**
Apply scalp dirt three times daily.

**Alternative Formula:**
Apply lead powder.

**Formula for Chronic Lip Sores (persisting for years):**
Extract juice from ten *jin* of indigo leaves in the eighth month, and wash the sores. Healing occurs within three days.

**Formula for Sudden Sores on Lips or Tongue:**
Burn white chicken droppings to ash, wrap in cloth, and hold against the affected area.

**Formula for Lip Nodules:**
Measure one *sheng* of pig dung, steep in water, and strain. Drink the warm liquid.

**Formula for Blackened, Swollen Lips (painful and itchy, unbearable):**
Rub four large coins on stone with lard from a twelfth-month pig, then apply the liquid.

**Alternative Formula:**

Apply a bamboo bow to flick out the foul blood for healing.

**Alternative Formula:**
Burn disheveled hair, wasp nests, and the fur of the six livestock into ash, mix with lard, and apply. Also treats sunken lips.

**Formula for Dry, Cracked Lips Bleeding in Winter:**
Pound peach kernels, mix with lard, and apply.

**Formula for Chapped Lips and Face During Long Journeys:**
Simmer lard until fully rendered, then apply to the face before night travel. With this, one may traverse ten thousand *li* and endure wild lodgings unharmed.

*Sun Zhenren’s Emergency Essential Prescriptions, Scroll Nineteen*
*Collated and Corrected by Lin Yi, Gentleman for Court Service and Vice Minister of the Court of Imperial Sacrifices, concurrently Proofreader of the Secret Pavilion, et al.*

**Formulas for the Seven Orifices**
**Sixth Discourse on Teeth: Formulas and Moxibustion**

It is said: For exposed tooth roots, most cases stem from *gan*-sores or "lunar erosion." Apply *jiaohao* ash at night to the gums, filling the gaps, and avoid consuming oil. Healing occurs within two or three nights. Eating oil or dried jujubes will cause relapse, so those with dental ailments must abstain from oil, dried jujubes, and *guixin*.

Each morning, take a pinch of *guan* powder into the mouth, swish with warm water, rub the teeth, and tap them one hundred times without ceasing. Within five days, the teeth will become firm and dense.

For those unable to eat fruits or vegetables due to exposed tooth roots, this *guan* decoction for rubbing and tapping the teeth will invariably cure the condition. It is divinely efficacious.

Dental diseases often arise from eating or drinking on nights of lunar eclipses. The wise should take great care to avoid this. Thus, during solar or lunar eclipses, one must abstain from food and drink—this applies to children as well.

**Formula for Dental Caries and Worm-Induced Toothache:**
- *Baifuzi* (6 *zhu*)
- *Zhimu* (6 *zhu*)
- *Xixin* (6 *zhu*)
- *Xiongqiong* (12 *zhu*)
- *Gaoliangjiang* (12 *zhu*)

Grind the five ingredients into powder. Wrap a small amount in silk and place it on the affected tooth. Spit out the saliva, and hold it in the mouth twice daily. Also treats bad breath.

**Alternative Formula:**
Cut a white horse’s hoof into rice-sized pieces, wrap in silk, and insert into the cavity of the aching tooth. No more than three applications are needed for efficacy.

**Formula for Dental Caries or Worm-Infested Teeth (persisting for years, from youth to old age):**
*Que mai* grass (also called *Dumu* grass, resembling *niumao* grass), with forty clean-washed bitter gourd leaves left in the dew overnight. At dawn, take the grass, bend it to two *cun* long, one *cun* wide, and five *fen* thick, then wrap and bind it with the gourd leaves to make fifty or sixty bundles. Soak them in three-year-old vinegar until midday, then take two bundles, roast them in fire until scorching hot, and press them against the outer side of the affected tooth. Replace when cool. Use a copper vessel filled with water to rinse the bundles after use. The extracted worms will be three *fen* long—older ones yellow-red, younger ones white. Many cases yield thirty or forty worms; fewer cases yield ten or twenty.

**Formula for Worm-Infested Teeth:**
Three *ge* of *genruo* seeds (if unavailable, onion or leek seeds may substitute). Heat seven bronze coins until red-hot, then place them in a small-mouthed jar suitable for holding in the mouth. Add a pinch of *genruo* seeds atop the coins, causing a crackling sound, then pour half a *ge* of water to generate steam. Hold the jar’s mouth to the mouth, ensuring no steam escapes, and fumigate the tooth. Repeat when cool, using all three *ge* of the medicine. This not only cures worm-infested teeth but also treats wind-induced toothache, dental caries, and other tooth ailments. Spit out excess saliva.

**Alternative Formula:**
Boil one *sheng* of chopped white poplar leaves in three *sheng* of water until reduced to one *sheng*, and hold the liquid in the mouth.

**Alternative Formula:**
Boil one *sheng* of wolfberry root bark in one *sheng* of strong vinegar until reduced to half a *sheng*, and hold the liquid in the mouth. The worms will emerge immediately.

**Alternative Formula:**
Pierce a small amount of peach kernel with a hairpin, roast it over a lamp until smoke appears, then blow out the flame after a moment. Place it in the mouth and bite down on the affected tooth. No more than five or six applications are needed. (One version uses walnut kernel.)

**Formula for *Gan*-Worms Eroding Tooth Roots:**
Place an earthworm on a stone, add a pinch of salt, and wait until it dissolves into liquid. Spread the liquid with dough, let it thicken, and apply to the affected area. Alternatively, apply peeled *zaojia* to the area, and the worms will emerge.

**Alternative Formula:**
Grind the remnants of a hemp-wick candle, mix with well water, and apply.

**Alternative Formula:**
Take equal parts black sheep fat and *langdangzi*, heat a red-hot iron hoe, axe, or mirror, place the ingredients on it, and let the smoke rise. Cover the head with a single cloth and inhale the smoke through the mouth.

**Formula for Swollen and Painful Gums, and Worm-Induced Toothache:**
*Huangqin*, licorice, *guixin*, *danggui*, *xixin*, and *shechuangzi*, one *liang* each.
Grind the six ingredients, then boil in seven *sheng* of vinegar-rinsed water until reduced to three *sheng*. Strain and hold the liquid in the mouth, three times by day and twice by night.

**Formula for Tooth Cavities Preventing Eating and Causing Facial Swelling:**
Seven leaves of *mangcao* and seven pieces of *zhujiao* root bark, each four *cun* long.
Grind the two ingredients, then boil in three *sheng* of vinegar-rinsed water until reduced to one *sheng*. Hold the liquid in the mouth; when fatigued, spit it out. Repeat two or three times daily.

**Formula for Swollen Tooth Roots:**
A handful of pine needles, chopped, and one *ge* of salt.
Boil the two ingredients in three *sheng* of wine until reduced to one *sheng*. Hold the liquid in the mouth.

**Formula for Loose Tooth Roots on the Verge of Falling Out:**
Wrap raw *dihuang* in silk and place it on the affected tooth, biting down.
Alternatively, grind the ingredients, soak the tooth roots in the juice, and apply four or five times daily, swallowing the juice as well. Significant improvement occurs within ten days.

**Formula for Painful, Loose Tooth Roots:**
Three *liang* each of raw *dihuang* and *duhuo*.
Grind the two ingredients, soak in one *sheng* of water overnight, then hold the liquid in the mouth.

**Formula for Unceasing Bleeding from the Gums:**
Two *liang* of raw bamboo shavings, boiled in vinegar and held in the mouth.

**Alternative Formula:**
Two *liang* of *xixin* and one *liang* of licorice.
Grind the two ingredients, then boil in two *sheng* of vinegar until reduced to one *sheng*. Hold the liquid in the mouth intermittently, day and night.

**Alternative Formula:**
One *liang* of *fanshi*, burned, boiled in three *sheng* of water until reduced to one *sheng*. First wipe away the blood, then hold the liquid in the mouth.
*Do not use afterward, as it rots the tooth roots and causes teeth to fall out.*

**Formula for Bleeding Between Teeth:**
Boil bitter bamboo leaves thickly, add a small amount of *guan* salt, adjust to a suitable temperature, and hold in the mouth. Spit out when cold.

**Alternative Formula:**
Half a *sheng* of warm boy’s urine; take three *ge* and hold in the mouth. The bleeding will cease immediately.

**Formula for Unceasing Tooth Bleeding:**
Scrape two *liang* of raw bamboo skin, soak in bitter wine, and have the patient sit unclothed. Have someone hold the liquid in their mouth and spray it onto the patient’s back three times. Then boil bamboo shavings thickly, without adding *guan* salt, adjust to a suitable temperature, and have the patient hold and rinse with the liquid throughout the day.

**Formula for Tooth Bleeding Due to Alcohol Intoxication:**
Two *liang* of *danggui*, six *zhu* of *fanshi*, one *liang* each of *guixin*, *xixin*, and licorice.
Grind the five ingredients, then boil in five *sheng* of vinegar-rinsed water until reduced to three *sheng*.

Hold the liquid in the mouth five or six times during the day and three times at night.

**Alternative Formula:**
Heat an iron nail until red-hot and insert it into the bleeding cavity to stop the bleeding.

**Formula for Wind-Afflicted Head and Face with Unbearable Mouth and Tooth Pain:**
Two *ge* of Sichuan pepper, ten leaves of *mangcao*, two *liang* each of *queli* root and *duhuo*, one *liang* each of *xixin*, *xiongqiong*, and *fangfeng*.
Chop the seven ingredients, then boil in two and a half *sheng* of wine until bubbling five times. Strain.
Hold the liquid in the mouth, spit when cold, and hold again without swallowing the juice.
Zhang Wenzhong’s version includes two *liang* of *baizhu*.

**Alternative Formula:**
Burn chicken droppings white to ash, wrap in silk, place on the aching tooth, and bite down.

**Alternative Formula:**
Boil *gouqi* juice and hold in the mouth.

**Alternative Formula:**
Boil chicken droppings white in vinegar, soak, and hold in the mouth gradually.

**Alternative Formula:**
One segment of fresh *dihuang* and one clove of garlic.
Pound thoroughly, wrap in silk, place on the painful area, and bite down without swallowing the juice. Spit it out afterward. Repeat daily until healed.

**Alternative Formula:**
Hold donkey urine in the mouth; the pain will cease shortly.

**Formula for Wind-Tooth Pain:**
Moxibust three cones at the anterior intersection of the high bone above the outer ankle.
Alternatively, measure the length from the middle finger to the transverse crease at the back of the hand, divide into four parts, and moxibust two cones at the midpoint behind the crease on the arm. Apply moxibustion according to the affected side.

**Mouth-Rinsing Decoction for Tooth Pain:**
Three *liang* each of *duhuo* and *danggui*, two *liang* each of *huangqin*, *xixin*, *xiongqiong*, and *bijie*, one *liang* of clove.
Chop the seven ingredients, boil in five *sheng* of water until reduced to two and a half *sheng*, and strain.
Hold and rinse in the mouth, spit when stifling, and hold again.
*The Ancient and Modern Proven Formulas* includes two *liang* of licorice.

**Alternative Formula:**
Hold white horse urine in the mouth according to the affected side, no more than three to five mouthfuls.

**Mouth-Rinsing Decoction for Tooth Pain:**
Two hundred rotten thorn bristles, boiled in two *sheng* of water until reduced to one *sheng*.
Hold and rinse gradually, four or five times daily, until healed.

**Alternative Formula:**
Equal parts of *xiongqiong*, *xixin*, *fangfeng*, *fanshi*, *fuzi*, *lilu*, and *mangcao*.
Grind into powder, wrap in silk the size of a bullet, soak in wine, and place on the affected area. Hold in the mouth without swallowing, three times daily. Piercing the skin is highly effective.

**Alternative Formula:**
Mix earthworm droppings with water to form a thick mud ball, fire until red-hot to powder, and blend with lard from a twelfth-month pig.
Apply to the gums two or three times daily for permanent relief.

**Alternative Formula:**
Grind dried, naturally deceased earthworms into powder and apply to the painful area to stop the pain immediately.

**Formula for Painful Gums Preventing the Consumption of Raw Fruit:**
Fresh *dihuang* and *guixin*.
Chew together until flavors blend, then swallow.

**Alternative Formula:**
Chew a handful of *machixian*; the pain will cease.

**Formula for Tooth Abscess Causing Lockjaw:**
One large *fuzi*, eighteen *zhu* of *huanglian*, one *liang* of *fanshi*.
Grind into powder and place in a tube.
Force the mouth open and blow the powder into the throat in small amounts.

**Formulas for the Seven Orifices: Throat Diseases (Seventh Section) – Symptoms, Formulas, Acupuncture, and Moxibustion Methods**

**Modified Minor Continued Life Decoction (Xiao Xuming Tang) with One Liang of Apricot Kernels** – Treats sudden throat impediment (*houbi*) with loss of speech. (Formula found in Volume Eight.)

**Wuqian Ointment** – For throat afflictions, which serve as indicators of the spleen and stomach. If the viscera are hot, the throat swells and becomes obstructed, disrupting the flow of spirit and qi. Formula:
- 10 *liang* of fresh *wuqian* (black false hellebore)
- 3 *liang* of *shengma* (black cohosh)
- 2 *liang* each of *lingyangjiao* (antelope horn), *tongcao* (rice-paper plant pith), and *shaoyao* (peony root)
- 1 *sheng* of sliced *qiangweigen* (rose root)
- 5 *ge* of sliced fresh *dihuang* (rehmannia)
- 2 *jin* of lard
- 6 *zhu* of *aiye* (mugwort leaves; fresh is best)

Pound the first eight ingredients, wrap in silk, and soak in 1 *sheng* of bitter wine overnight. Place in lard and simmer over low heat until the wine evaporates and the ointment no longer crackles. Strain. Wrap a small amount of the ointment in thin silk, forming a piece the size of a large apricot kernel. Insert into the throat and swallow gradually.

**Formula for Throat Swelling and Pain with Wind-Toxin Attacking the Heart and Chest:**
- 1.5 *sheng* of *chi* (fermented soybeans)
- 2 *liang* each of *xijiao* (rhinoceros horn), *shegan* (blackberry lily rhizome), *xingren* (apricot kernels), and *gancao* (licorice)
- 3 *liang* of *shaoyao* (peony root)
- 7 pieces of *zhizi* (gardenia fruit)
- 4 *liang* of *shengma* (black cohosh)
- 1.5 *liang* of *lingyangjiao* (antelope horn)

Pound the ingredients, boil in 9 *sheng* of water, and reduce to 3 *sheng*. Strain, add the *chi*, and bring to a single boil. Divide into three doses.

**Formula for Throat Swelling with Fullness in the Chest and Rib-Sides:**
Moxibustion at *chize* (LU 5) with one hundred cones.

**Formula for Wind-Toxin, Inability to Swallow Water, and Scrofulous Swellings:**
- 6 *liang* each of *shengma* (black cohosh) and *shaoyao* (peony root)
- 3 *liang* each of *shegan* (blackberry lily rhizome), *xingren* (apricot kernels), *fengxiang* (liquidambar resin), *gegen* (kudzu root), and *mahuang* (ephedra)
- 2 *liang* of *gancao* (licorice)

Pound the ingredients, boil in 8 *sheng* of water, and reduce to 2.5 *sheng*. Divide into three doses.

**Alternative Formula:**
Take 2 *qianbi* of *langdangzi* (henbane seed) powder with water. Highly effective.

**Formulas for Throat Impediment (*Houbi*):**
- Sip *jingli* (schizonepeta juice) gradually. Effective.
- Burn ox horn to ash and take with wine. Effective.
- Burn a pig’s tail from the twelfth month to ash and take with water. Beneficial.
- Hold *ying* (parrot) droppings (white part).
- Roast apricot kernels until black; hold in the mouth or take as powder.
- Remove the skin of *badou* (croton seed), thread with a needle, swallow, then pull out.
- Boil 0.5 *sheng* of *malanzi* (horse orchid seeds) in 2 *sheng* of water, reduce to 1.5 *sheng*, and consume.
- Boil 3 *sheng* of peach bark juice and consume.
- Burn *jing* (schizonepeta) and take the juice.
- Boil a handful of *jing* (schizonepeta) in 3 *sheng* of water, reduce to 1 *sheng*, and divide into three doses.
- Prick the crease of the small finger’s nail, letting blood the size of three large soybeans. Prick the corresponding side (left or right).

**Avoid wine and toxic foods in all cases.**

**Formulas for Throat Impediment and Toxic Qi:**
- Boil 2 *liang* of *jiegeng* (platycodon root) in 3 *sheng* of water, reduce to 1 *sheng*, and consume in one dose.
- Pound 2 *jin* of fresh ginger to extract the juice, mix with 5 *ge* of honey, and simmer over low heat. Take 1 *ge* five times daily.
- Slice 1 *fuzi* (aconite) into large pieces, coat with honey, and roast until yellow. Hold in the mouth and swallow the juice; reapply honey and roast as before when the sweetness is exhausted.
- Peel a large garlic clove and plug the ears and nose, replacing twice daily.

**Formula for Sudden Throat Impediment with Loss of Speech:**
- Simmer cinnamon to a thick juice and consume 1 *sheng*.
- Alternatively, grind cinnamon to powder and place under the tongue, swallowing gradually. Effective.
- Boil soybean juice and hold in the mouth. If soybeans are unavailable, use *chi* (fermented soybeans). Also effective.
- Mix 5 *ge* of wine with 0.5 *sheng* of human breast milk and divide into two doses.
- Burn a steaming basket to ash, take three pinches with water.
- Mix mustard seed powder with water and apply externally; replace when dry.
- Simmer *shanglu* (pokeberry root) in bitter wine until thick and apply warm.
- Grind *guixin* (cinnamon heart) to the size of a jujube pit, wrap in silk, and place under the tongue. It will break apart shortly.

**Formula for Sudden Throat Swelling Preventing Food Intake:**
- Pound a handful of *jiu* (Chinese leek), stir-fry, and apply externally. Replace when cool.

Hold fine vinegar in the mouth; effective for mouth and tongue sores as well.

**Formula for Sudden Swelling of the Uvula:**
- Grind equal parts dried ginger and *banxia* (pinellia) to powder and place a small amount on the tongue.
- Another formula: Grind *guan* (alum) to powder, use the tip of a chopstick to apply inside the mouth, five times daily.

**Formula for Uvular Swelling, Throat Polyps, and Tongue Swelling:**
- At sunrise, face the sun with mouth open while a woman uses the left hem of her garment to gently press the top of the head seven times to cure.
- Another formula: Boil *yangticao* (sheep’s-hoof grass) and hold the juice in the mouth.
- Another formula: Mix *guan* (alum) and *chi* (fermented soybeans) and apply; highly effective.
- Another formula: Collect urine from a four- or five-year-old child, mix with salt, and hold in the mouth.

**Formula for Severe Throat Swelling Extending to the Cheek (Horse Throat Swelling), with Frequent Exhalation:**
- Boil one horse bit in two *sheng* of water, reduce to one *sheng*, and divide into three doses.
- Another formula: Burn thirty-seven *canger* (xanthium) seeds from felt, grind to powder, and take with water.
- Another formula: Take a handful of *mabiancao* (verbena) root, avoiding wind exposure, cut off both ends, pound to extract juice, and consume; highly effective.
- Another formula: Burn *gunu* (mildew on grain) to ash and take with wine to immediately resolve swelling.

**Mother Ginger Wine** is used for disorders of the throat gate, which governs the liver and gallbladder.
- If the viscera are hot, the throat gate becomes obstructed and qi is blocked;
- If the bowels are cold, the throat gate becomes damaged and the voice hoarse.
This formula is effective for such conditions:
- Mother ginger juice: 2 *sheng*
- *Su* (refined butter): 1 *sheng*
- Ox marrow: 1 *sheng*
- Oil: 1 *sheng*
- *Guixin* (cinnamon heart): 1 *liang*
- *Qinjiao* (gentiana): 1 *liang*
- *Fangfeng* (saposhnikovia): 1.5 *liang*
- *Xiongqiong* (ligusticum): 1 *liang* 6 *zhu*
- *Duhuo* (angelica): 1 *liang* 6 *zhu*

Grind the nine ingredients to powder, add to the ginger juice, and simmer until thick. Add the marrow, *su*, and oil, stirring until well blended. Simmer over low heat, stirring three times up and down. At dawn, take 2 *ge* of the ointment with 1 *sheng* of warm clear wine, swallowing slowly. Take three times daily and once at night.

Another formula:
- *Danshen* (salvia): 1 *liang*
- *Shengma* (cimicifuga): 1 *liang*
- *Xionghuang* (realgar): 1 *liang*
- *Xingren* (apricot kernel): 1 *liang*
- *Guijiu* (podophyllum): 1 *liang*
- *Gancao* (licorice): 1 *liang*
- *Shegan* (belamcanda): 1 *liang*
- *Shexiang* (musk): 0.5 *liang*

Grind the eight ingredients to powder and form into pills the size of *wutong* seeds with honey. Take one pill with water, increasing to five pills, three times daily. Taking with wine is also effective. Highly effective for throat pain, loss of voice, and difficulty speaking.

**Formula for Throat Injury with Hoarse Voice:**
- Wine: 1 *sheng*
- *Su* (refined butter): 1 *sheng*
- Dried ginger powder: 2.5 *liang*
- *Tongcao* (tetrapanax): 2 *liang*
- *Guixin* (cinnamon heart): 2 *liang*
- *Shichangpu* (acorus): 2 *liang*

Combine the six ingredients. Take one spoonful three times daily.

Another formula:
- Wine: 1 *sheng*
- *Su* (refined butter): 1 *sheng*
- Dried ginger powder: 10 *liang*

Mix 2 *ge* of wine, 1 spoonful of *su*, and 2 spoonfuls of ginger powder, and consume three times daily after meals. Also treats lung abscess.

**Formula for Hoarseness, Blockage, and Cough:**
- *Guixin* (cinnamon heart): 6 *zhu*
- *Xingren* (apricot kernel): 18 *zhu*

Grind to powder and form into pills the size of apricot kernels with honey. Hold in the mouth, swallowing the juice slowly, day and night without interruption.

**Formula for Throat Pain, Counterflow Qi, and Inability to Eat:**
- *Mazi* (hemp seeds): 1 *sheng*, stir-fry until black, steep in 1 *sheng* of wine to extract juice.
- Take 1 *sheng* on an empty stomach, gradually increasing to 2 *sheng*.
- Sweat profusely and cover well; avoid wind and cold.
This formula also treats postpartum women and men with wind stroke, such as arched-back rigidity and locked jaw, with great efficacy, comparable to *zitang* (purple decoction).

**Formula for Sudden Throat Pain:**
- Burn *xuanmugou* (Chinese boxthorn) to ash and take 1 *fangcunbi* with water three times daily.
- Another formula: Burn one *chuandan* (steaming basket) and take 1 *fangcunbi* with fermented water.

**Formula for Sudden Wind-Induced Throat and Facial Swelling:**
- Grind *xingren* (apricot kernel) to powder, mix with egg yolk, and pound further. Apply externally, replacing when dry, seven or eight times.
- If swelling produces fluid, boil vinegar with *fulonggan* (hearth ashes) and apply, replacing when dry.

**Formula for Corpse Throat:**
- Burn the nose strap of shoes to ash and take with warm water.
- Another formula: Burn hemp seed oil and consume; highly effective.

**Formula for Throat Discomfort and Qi Descent:**
- *Shegan* (belamcanda): 1 *liang*
- *Xingren* (apricot kernel): 1 *liang*
- *Renshen* (ginseng): 1 *liang*
- *Fuzi* (aconite): 1 *liang*
- *Guixin* (cinnamon heart): 1 *liang*

Grind to powder and form into finger-sized pills with honey. Hold one pill in the mouth, swallowing the juice gradually to ensure the medicinal flavor persists.

**Formula for Throat Pain and Itching, with Inability to Spit or Swallow (Resembling Gu Poison):**
- Hold fresh ginger in the mouth for fifty days to cure.
- Another formula: Wrap *mahuang* (ephedra) in blue cloth, burn, and use a bamboo tube to direct the smoke into the throat.

**Ear Disorders, Eighth Section**

**Formula for Kidney Heat with Back Tension, Spasms, Ear Discharge of Pus and Blood, or Flesh Obstruction Causing Deafness:**
- *Cishi* (magnetite): 5 *liang*
- *Baizhu* (atractylodes): 5 *liang*
- *Muli* (oyster shell): 5 *liang*
- *Gancao* (licorice): 1 *liang*
- Scallion white: 1 *sheng*
- Fresh *dihuang* (rehmannia) juice: 1 *sheng*
- *Shaoyao* (peony): 4 *liang*
- *Dazao* (jujube): 15 pieces
- Fresh *maimendong* (ophiopogon): 6 *liang*

Chop the nine ingredients, boil in 9 *sheng* of water, and reduce to 3 *sheng*. Divide into three doses.

**Formula for Kidney Heat with Darkened Face, Pale Eyes, Internal Kidney Qi Injury, Tinnitus, Shortness of Breath, Limb Pain, Lumbar and Back Tension, and Dark Yellow Urine:**
- *Baizhu* (atractylodes): 5 *liang*
- Fresh ginger: 6 *liang*
- *Xuanshen* (scrophularia): 4 *liang*
- *Zexie* (alisma): 2 *liang*
- *Danzhuye* (bamboo leaf), chopped: 2 *sheng*
- *Shaoyao* (peony): 3 *liang*
- *Fuling* (poria): 3 *liang*
- Sheep kidney: 1 pair, prepared as for consumption
- Fresh *dihuang* (rehmannia), chopped: 1 *sheng*

Chop the nine ingredients, boil the sheep kidney and bamboo leaves in 2 *dou* of water, reduce to 1 *dou*, strain, and clarify. Add the remaining ingredients and boil to 3 *sheng*. Divide into three doses. If unresolved, take another dose after three days.

**Formula for Kidney Heat with Continuous Ear Discharge of Pus and Blood:**
- Carp brain: 1
- Carp intestines: 1 set, washed and finely chopped
- Pickled carp: 3 *jin*
- *Wumazi* (black sesame), stir-fried until fragrant: 1 *sheng*

First pound the sesame seeds, then add the remaining ingredients and grind into a paste. Place in a container and warm over low heat. Wrap in cloth and apply thinly to the ear. After the time it takes to eat a meal, unwrap; white worms will emerge. Prepare the medicine again.

If both ears discharge pus, use this as a single dose and apply thinly to both ears. If only one ear is affected, divide the medicine into two doses; no more than three applications will be needed for a cure. Avoid wind and cold.

**Formula for Kidney Deficiency-Cold, Lumbar and Spinal Pain, Weakness of Yin and Yang, Tinnitus, and Dry Ears:**
- Fresh rehmannia juice: 2 *sheng*
- Grilled sheep kidney: 1 set
- White atractylodes: 1 *jin*
- Fermented wheat: 1 *jin*
- Licorice: 8 *liang*
- Dried ginger: 8 *liang*
- Lycium bark: 8 *liang*
- Cinnamon bark: 4 *liang*
- Eucommia bark: 4 *liang*
- Astragalus: 4 *liang*
- Chinese angelica: 3 *liang*
- Schisandra berries: 3 *liang*
- White honey: 3 *sheng*
- Fresh asparagus juice: 3 *sheng*

Grind the fourteen ingredients into powder and place in a basin. Mix with the juices of the first three ingredients, then warm the basin over low heat. Re-grind while warm, dry in the sun daily, and continue grinding until the mixture detaches from the basin. Take one *fangcunbi* with wine, twice daily.

**Formula for Deafness, Tinnitus, and Ear Discharge Due to Kidney Cold, Even Persisting for Ten or Twenty Years:**
- *Zhe* root: 30 *jin*
- Acorus, chopped: 5 *dou*

Boil each in 1 *shi* of water, reduce to 5 *dou*, strain, and clarify.
- Old iron: 20 *jin*

Burn until red-hot, soak in 5 *dou* of water for three nights, then strain and clarify.

Combine the three ingredients to make 1 *shi* 5 *dou*. Use 2 *shi* of rice and 2 *dou* of yeast, brew according to standard methods. Once the wine is ready, seal for one month, then open and clarify. Take 3 *jin* of magnetite (which attracts iron), grind into powder, and steep in the wine for three nights. Drink day and night, maintaining mild intoxication before sleep; cease the medicine upon hearing human speech.

**Alternative Formula:**
Take asparagus wine for one hundred days to cure. The formula is found in another volume.

**Another Formula:**

A pinch of alum, mixed with fresh acorus root juice, to be applied into the ear.

**Formula for Consumptive Deafness, Qi Deafness, Wind Deafness, Deficiency Deafness, Toxic Deafness, and Chronic Deafness with Tinnitus:**
- Cornus officinalis: 2 *liang*
- Dried ginger: 2 *liang*
- Morinda officinalis: 2 *liang*
- Peony: 2 *liang*
- Alisma: 2 *liang*
- Cinnamon bark: 2 *liang*
- Cuscuta: 2 *liang*
- Astragalus: 2 *liang*
- Dried rehmannia: 2 *liang*
- Polygala: 2 *liang*
- Cnidium fruit: 2 *liang*
- Dendrobium: 2 *liang*
- Chinese angelica: 2 *liang*
- Asarum: 2 *liang*
- Cistanche: 2 *liang*
- Moutan: 2 *liang*
- Ginseng: 2 *liang*
- Licorice: 2 *liang*
- Aconite: 2 *liang*
- Poria: 2 *liang*
- Acorus: 1 *liang*
- Sheep kidney: 2 pieces
- Ledebouriella: 1.5 *liang*

Grind the twenty-three ingredients into powder and form into honey pills the size of *wutong* seeds. Take fifteen pills after meals, three times daily, increasing gradually to thirty or forty pills. All deafness stems from kidney deficiency; thus, this formula tonifies the kidney and also acts as a mild unblocking agent for the nine orifices to effect a cure.

**Formula for Deafness:**
- Croton seed: 7 pieces
- Apricot kernel: 7 pieces
- Crystalline salt: 2 pellets
- Fresh rehmannia, coarsely cut, 1.5 *cun* long
- Human hair, the size of a chicken egg, burned to ash

Grind the five ingredients and sift. Wrap in thin silk and insert into the ear for one day and night. If slight irritation occurs, remove it and simply plug the ear with another object. Yellow fluid and pus will drain; gradual improvement will follow. Do not reinsert immediately. After one night, reinsert for another day and night, then remove as before.

**Alternative Formula:**
- Castor bean: 5 *ge*
- Apricot kernel: 3 *fen*
- Acorus: 3 *fen*
- Magnetite: 3 *fen*
- Peach kernel: 3 *fen*
- Halite: 3 *fen*
- Tetrapanax: 3 *fen*
- Croton seed: 1 *fen*
- Aconite: 2 *fen*
- Frankincense: 10 *fen*
- Pine resin: 10 *fen*
- Wax: 8 *fen*

First grind the herbs and minerals finely, then separately grind the kernels into a paste. Add pine resin and wax, and pound together several thousand times until the mixture can be formed into pills. Shape into pieces the size of a jujube pit, wrap in silk, and insert into the ear, replacing four or five times daily. Remove and twist the plug; replace every three or four days.

**Alternative Formula:**
- Magnetite: 4 *liang*
- Asparagus root: 3 *liang*
- Lycium bark: 3 *liang*
- Fresh ginger: 3 *liang*
- Cornus fruit: 2 *liang*
- Trichosanthes root: 2 *liang*
- Vitex seed: 2 *liang*
- Poria: 2 *liang*
- Acorus: 2 *liang*
- Ligusticum: 2 *liang*
- Gardenia fruit: 2 *liang*
- Angelica: 2 *liang*
- Tangerine peel: 2 *liang*
- Licorice: 2 *liang*
- Bamboo sap: 2 *sheng*

The fifteen ingredients above are to be cut and decocted in eight *sheng* of water until reduced by half, then add the bamboo sap and continue boiling to yield two *sheng* and five *ge*. Divide into three doses; prepare one formula every five days. For the three [ingredients] to be applied as powder, insert into the ear as described in the following formula.

**Alternative Formula:**
- Magnetite: 4 *liang*
- Stone acorus: 2 *liang*
- Ampelopsis: 2 *liang*
- Moutan: 2 *liang*
- Cornus fruit: 2 *liang*
- Achyranthes: 2 *liang*
- Trichosanthes root: 2 *liang*

Grind the seven ingredients above and sift into powder. Wrap in silk and insert into the ear, replacing once daily. Concurrently, taking the "Great Three-Five-Seven Powder" is excellent. The formula is found in another volume.

**Alternative Formula:**
- Wax
- Pine resin
- Frankincense
- Magnetite
- Salt
- Human hair ash

Take equal parts of the six ingredients above, grind into powder, and form into pills. Wrap in silk and insert into the ear, replacing frequently until the condition resolves.

**Alternative Formula:**
- Croton seed: 14 pieces
- Refined pine resin: ½ *liang*

Combine and process the two ingredients above, forming pills the size of millet grains. Wrap in silk and insert into the ear using a hairpin, replacing once daily. If the medicine hardens, warm it slightly over a fire until it softens and exudes liquid; this is highly effective.

**Alternative Formula:**
- Saposhnikovia: 6 *zhu*
- Acorus: 6 *zhu*
- Asarum: 6 *zhu*
- Aconite: 6 *zhu*
- Ligusticum: 6 *zhu*
- Carp brain: 2 pieces

Cut the six ingredients above, then combine with the carp brain and decoct, stirring three times up and three times down until the ointment becomes fragrant. Strain to remove dregs, allow to cool, and pour a quantity the size of a jujube pit into the ear, then plug with silk. *The Ancient and Modern Proven Formulas* uses this to treat chronic wind-induced deafness with ringing in the ears, substituting *Angelica* for *Saposhnikovia* and *Angelica dahurica* for *Ligusticum*.

**Alternative Formula:**
Fill a bamboo tube with carp brain and steam it where rice is cooked until melted, then pour into the ear.

**Alternative Formula:**
- Equal parts *Acorus* and *Aconite*, ground to powder and mixed with sesame oil.
Wrap in silk and insert into the ear. *The Guangji Formulas* uses this to treat sudden ear pain so severe it feels unbearable; *Master Cui’s Formulas* mixes the powder with bitter wine and plugs the ear with it.

**Alternative Formula:**
Heat iron until red-hot, then plunge into wine and drink. Also, plug the ear with *magnetite*, replacing it once daily and removing it at night. Reinsert a fresh piece the next morning.

**Alternative Formula:**
- *Castor bean*: 100 seeds, peeled
- *Jujube*: 15 fruits, peeled and pitted

Pound the two ingredients thoroughly and form into pills the size of apricot kernels. Insert into the ear; the condition will resolve in twenty days.

**Alternative Formula:**
Crush *mustard seeds* and mix with a boy’s milk. Wrap in silk and insert into the ear.

**Alternative Formula:**
Extract juice from *Bupleurum* shoots and pour into the ear. A second application will cure the condition.

**Alternative Formula:**
Dig a pit large enough to hold about two *sheng*, place burning charcoal inside, and shape the pit like a kiln. Cover the opening with a brick, leaving a hole the size of a little finger. Place one *sheng* of *Rehmannia* over the brick’s hole, then cover with a wooden basin and seal the edges with mud to prevent leakage. Bore a small hole in the basin’s base, wide enough for chopsticks, and layer three pieces of cloth over it. Align the ear with the basin’s opening to receive the steam. If discomfort arises, remove the yellow fluid and plug the ear with a cloth-wrapped *Gleditsia* pod. No more than two or three applications are needed for miraculous efficacy.

**Alternative Formula:**
Pound *fermented soybeans* into a cake and pack into the ear. Carve a *Rehmannia* piece to a length of five or six *fen*, taper one end, and insert it into the ear until flush with the soybean cake. Cover with *Schima* leaves, then bore a hole the width of a chopstick tip through the cake. Apply three moxa cones to the hole.

**Alternative Formula:**
Form a mud cake as thick as wonton skin and place it over the ear, sealing the edges to prevent qi leakage. Pierce a small hole in the cake above the ear canal with a straw, then apply one hundred moxa cones. Stop when the pain becomes unbearable, then tilt the ear to drain the yellow fluid completely. Replace the mud cake if it dries during moxibustion.

**Alternative Formula:**
Steep two *sheng* of crushed *Vitex* seeds in three *sheng* of wine for seven days, then strain. Drink freely until finished. Even thirty-year deafness will be cured.

**Alternative Formula:**
Cut a two-*cun* section of arrow shaft, insert it into the ear, and seal the edges with dough to prevent qi leakage. Apply seven moxa cones to the top of the shaft.

**Alternative Formula:**
Grind equal parts sulfur and realgar into powder. Wrap in silk and insert into the ear; after several days, one will hear human speech.

**Alternative Formula:**
Wrap snake fat in silk and plug the ear—highly effective.

**Alternative Formula:**
Steep aconite in pure vinegar over low heat for one night, then pare it to fit the ear. Wrap in silk and insert—excellent.

**Alternative Formula:**
Take half a *liang* each of alum, licorice, calamus, Chinese angelica, asarum, *Saposhnikovia*, *Ligusticum*, cuttlebone, aconite, and *Gleditsia*, along with fourteen croton seeds. Thinly slice the twelve ingredients, soak in three *sheng* of vinegar overnight, then fry in nine *ge* of chicken fat (untainted by water) with three rounds of heating and cooling. When the croton seeds turn yellow, remove the dregs, add powdered realgar, and stir well. Drip a piece the size of a jujube pit into the ear, then plug with silk, replacing it three times daily.

**Alternative Formula:**
Take eighteen *zhu* of cinnamon bark, six *zhu* of *Gelsemium*, and five *liang* of rendered chicken fat. Chop the ingredients, simmer in a copper vessel over low heat until bubbling three times, then strain. Store tightly sealed to prevent leakage. Fill a reed tube with a piece the size of a jujube pit, warm slightly over fire, then lie on one side and pour into the ear. Repeat for ten days, and the earwax will emerge, thick as a finger and an inch long. For long-standing deafness of up to thirty years, wrap the ointment in hair and insert deeply, ensuring no qi escapes; remove after five days.

*The Essential Prescriptions of the Golden Cabinet* states this cures twenty-year deafness.

**For Deafness with Dry Earwax That Will Not Discharge:**
Pound a naturally deceased white-necked earthworm, place it in a scallion leaf, seal the ends with dough, and steam until liquefied. Drip the juice into the ear until full, repeating several times to easily remove the wax. After healing, plug the ear with hair-wrapped cotton.

*Emergency Prescriptions to Keep Up One’s Sleeve* notes this also instantly cures earwig infestation.

**Alternative Formula:**
Pour three-year-old vinegar into the ear—most effective. Alternatively, plug with silk for half a day, and something will emerge.

**Red Ointment for Deafness and Toothache:**
Take one *liang* each of cinnamon bark, rhubarb, atractylodes, asarum, and *Ligusticum*; two *liang* of dried ginger; five *liang* of *Salvia*; one *sheng* of Sichuan pepper; ten croton seeds; and two large aconite roots. Chop the ten ingredients, soak in two *sheng* of bitter wine overnight, then add three *jin* of rendered lard and fry with three rounds of heating and cooling. Strain when done. May be taken internally or applied externally. For deafness, wrap in silk and insert into the ear; for cold-sensitive toothache, place between the teeth; for general pain, apply as a salve. For internal ailments, mix with wine and take a piece the size of a jujube pit; for throat pain, swallow a piece the size of a jujube pit.

**For Sudden Deafness:**
Take six *zhu* each of asarum and calamus, and ten *zhu* each of apricot kernels and yeast powder. Combine, pound into pills, and if dry, add a little lard. Take a piece the size of a jujube pit, wrap in silk, and insert into the ear, replacing daily. Once slightly improved, replace every two days, removing at night and reinserting at dawn.

**For Thirty-Year Deafness:**
Soak thirty *jin* of scrap iron in seven *dou* of water for three nights, then strain the liquid. Add yeast and brew with seven *dou* of rice as in standard wine-making. Once fermented, grind one *jin* of magnetite into powder, steep in the wine for three days, then drink until intoxicated. Wrap the magnetite in silk and insert into the ear, covering the head well. Remove upon sobering—the condition will be cured.

**Powder for Deafness with Pus:**
Take one *liang* of aconite, six *zhu* of *Limonite*, and half a *liang* each of oven earth, dragon bone, soot from the bottom of a pot, and cuttlebone. Grind into powder. Take a piece the size of a *Gleditsia* seed, wrap in silk, and insert into the ear, replacing daily until healed. If unhealed, add a bean-sized piece of musk.

**For Deafness with Pus and Parasites:**
Mix three *ge* of vinegar with one set of chopped carp intestines. Pound together, wrap in cloth, and insert into the ear. After the time it takes to eat a meal, discomfort will arise, and white parasites will adhere to the medicine. Remove and replace with fresh medicine until the parasites are gone. The used medicine may still be employed to eliminate parasites.

**Alternative Formula:**
First dry the ear’s discharge with paper, then dust with powdered alum. Next, apply powdered halite on top and remain lying down for the time it takes to eat a meal. Repeat no more than twice for permanent healing.

**Alternative Formula:**
Pound cinnamon, mix with carp brain, and insert into the ear. Healing occurs in no more than three or four applications.

**For Tinnitus and Deafness:**
Take six *zhu* each of Chinese angelica, asarum, *Ligusticum*, *Saposhnikovia*, aconite, and *Angelica dahurica*. Grind into powder, combine with eight *liang* of carp brain, and fry with three rounds of heating and cooling. Strain when the ointment is ready. Drip a piece the size of a jujube pit into the ear, then plug the ear with silk at dawn.

**For Tinnitus Caused by Water Entry:**
Take six *zhu* each of aconite and alum; twenty *zhu* each of Chinese angelica and licorice; eighteen *zhu* each of rice-paper plant pith, asarum, and cinnamon bark; one *liang* of calamus; and one and a half *liang* of *Aralia cordata*. Grind into powder, mix gradually with half a *ge* of white goose fat, and take a piece the size of a jujube pit. Wrap in silk and insert into the ear, replacing three times daily. Some versions use half a *ge* of scallion juice instead.

**For Tinnitus Like Flowing Water (Untreated, Leads to Deafness):**
Dig up a fresh aconite root, pare while moist into a piece the size of a jujube pit, and insert into the ear, replacing daily. Healing occurs in no more than three days. Also cures itching and sudden wind-induced deafness.

**For Suppurative Otitis with Pus:**
Take equal parts alum, coptis, cuttlebone, and red halloysite. Grind into powder.

Wrap a piece the size of a jujube pit in silk and insert into the ear, replacing three times daily. The *Xiaopin* version omits red halloysite, while Master Yao’s formula adds one *liang* of dragon bone; the *Qianjin Yifang* follows Master Yao’s version.

**For Suppurative Otitis with Pain and Pus-Blood Discharge:**
Take soot from beneath a cauldron, apply thinly into the ear, and replace three times daily. Each time, remove the old application with a small comb before reapplying, continuing until healed.

**For Suppurative Otitis:**
Take ripe peach kernels, pound thoroughly, wrap in old binding silk, and insert into the ear, replacing three times daily until healed.

**For Chronic Otitis (Bottom Ear):**
Take roasted yellow alum, wrap in silk, and insert into the ear; healing occurs within two or three days. Alternatively, blow into the ear through a reed tube. The *Zhoufu* states this also treats sudden ear swelling with pus.

**For Insects Entering the Ear:**
Grind a pinch of Sichuan pepper into powder, mix with half a *sheng* of vinegar, and pour into the ear. Walk twenty paces, and the insect will emerge.

**Alternative Formula:**
Char peach leaves over fire, roll them up, and plug the ear; the insect will emerge immediately.

**Alternative Formula:**
Apply axle grease to the ear opening, and the insect will emerge on its own. The *Zhouhou* states this also treats suppurative otitis with pus and blood.

**Alternative Formula:**
Pour scallion juice into the ear, and the insect will emerge. This also treats deafness.

**For Centipedes Entering the Ear:**
Roast pork until fragrant, then cover the ear; the centipede will emerge.

**For Maggots Entering the Ear:**
Stir-fry sesame seeds, grind them, place in a kudzu-cloth bag, and lean the ear upon it; the maggots will emerge.

**Alternative Formula:**
Pour cow’s milk fat into the ear until full, and the maggots will emerge, partially dissolved. If they enter the abdomen, consume one to two *sheng* of fine milk fat on an empty stomach, and they will transform into yellow fluid and discharge. If not fully expelled, consume more; this method is divinely effective. The *Qianjin Yifang* uses cow’s milk.

**For Objects Lodged in the Ear (Unable to Emerge):**
Separate the strands of a bowstring, apply fine glue, and gently press against the object in the ear until adhered. Slowly draw it out.

*Sun Zhenren’s* *Beiji Qianjin Yaofang*, Volume Twenty, concludes here.

**Formulas for the Seven Orifices: Facial Remedies (Ninth Section)**

**Five Fragrances Powder**
Treats facial blemishes, dark spots, and red discoloration, rendering the complexion luminous and fair.
*Ingredients:*
Astragalus (*huangqi*) 2 *liang*
White Poria (*bai fuling*) 2 *liang*
Solomon’s Seal (*weirui*) 2 *liang*
Pollia (*du ruo*) 2 *liang*
Sprouted Soybean (*dadou huangjuan*) 2 *liang*
Poke Root (*shanglu*) 2 *liang*
Dahurian Angelica (*baizhi*) 3 *liang*
Chinese Angelica (*danggui*) 3 *liang*
Giant Typhonium (*baifuzi*) 3 *liang*
Winter Melon Seed (*dongguaren*) 3 *liang*
Asarum (*duheng*) 3 *liang*
White Silkworm (*baijiangcan*) 3 *liang*
Magnolia Flower (*xinyi ren*) 3 *liang*
Cyperus (*xiang fuzi*) 3 *liang*
Clove (*dingzixiang*) 3 *liang*
Sichuan Water Flower (*shu shuihua*) 3 *liang*
Inula Flower (*xuanfuhua*) 3 *liang*
Saposhnikovia (*fangfeng*) 3 *liang*
Magnolia Bark (*mulan*) 3 *liang*
Chuanxiong (*xiongqiong*) 3 *liang*
Burnet Root (*gaoben*) 3 *liang*
Gleditsia Pod (*zaojia*) 3 *liang*
Donkey-Hide Gelatin (*baijiao*) 3 *liang*
Apricot Kernel (*xingren*) 3 *liang*
Asparagus Root (*tianmendong*) 3 *liang*
Mongolian Snake Gourd Root (*tuguagen*) 3 *liang*
White Atractylodes (*baizhu*) 3 *liang*
Mume Fruit (*meirou*) 3 *liang*
Black Nightshade (*suanjiang*) 3 *liang*
Duckweed (*shuiping*) 3 *liang*
Mung Bean (*bidou*) 4 *liang*
Dried Pig Pancreas (*zhuyi*) 2 pieces

Grind the thirty-two ingredients into a fine powder. Wash the face with this for fourteen days to achieve a fair complexion, distinct from others after a year.

**Facial and Hand Wash for Brightness and Smoothness**
*Ingredients:*
Mung Bean Flour (*bidou mian*) 1 *sheng*
Fine Rice (*mian*) 3 *sheng* (mixed with pig pancreas into cakes, dried, and sifted)
Winter Melon Seed (*dongguaren*) 4 *ge*
Pig Pancreas (*zhuyi*) 2 large pieces, finely chopped
White Poria (*bai fuling*) 1 *liang*
Dahurian Angelica (*baizhi*) 1 *liang*
Dictamnus Root (*baixianpi*) 1 *liang*
Trichosanthes Seed (*gualouzi*) 1 *liang*
White Atractylodes (*baizhu*) 1 *liang*
Giant Typhonium (*baifuzi*) 1 *liang*
Ampelopsis (*bailian*) 1 *liang*
Cuscuta Seed (*tusizi*) 1 *liang*
Mongolian Snake Gourd Root (*tuguagen*) 1 *liang*
Notopterygium (*qianghuo*) 1 *liang*
Solomon’s Seal (*weirui*) 1 *liang*
Peach Kernel (*taoren*) 1 *liang*
Apricot Kernel (*xingren*) 1 *liang*
Poke Root (*shanglu*) 1 *liang*
Chuanxiong (*xiongqiong*) 1 *liang*

Grind and sift the nineteen ingredients, then blend with the mung bean flour and pig pancreas, pounding again until uniform. Use daily with fermented water for washing; highly effective.

**Alternative Formula**
*Ingredients:*
Mung Bean Flour (*bidou mian*) 1 *sheng*
Trichosanthes Fruit (*gualou shi*) 3 *liang* (some omit this)
Pig Pancreas (*zhuyi*) 5 pieces, finely chopped
Mongolian Snake Gourd Root (*tuguagen*) 5 *liang*
White Poria (*bai fuling*) 5 *liang*
Solomon’s Seal (*weifu*) 5 *liang*
Gleditsia Pod (*zaojia*) 3 stalks

Grind and sift the seven ingredients, then blend with the pig pancreas, pounding until uniform. Wash face and hands each morning; skin will become fair and clear in one hundred days.

**Another Formula**
*Ingredients:*
Dahurian Angelica (*baizhi*)
Ampelopsis (*bailian*)
White Atractylodes (*baizhu*)
Peach Kernel (*taoren*)
Winter Melon Seed (*dongguaren*)
Apricot Kernel (*xingren*)
Solomon’s Seal (*weirui*) (equal parts)
Gleditsia Pod (*zaojia*) (double the quantity)

Grind the eight ingredients into powder and sift through silk. Use when washing face and hands.

**Yet Another Formula**
*Ingredients:*
Mung Bean Flour (*bidou mian*) 3 *sheng* (soybean flour may substitute)
Dahurian Angelica (*baizhi*) 2 *liang*
Costus Root (*qingmuxiang*) 2 *liang*
